greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of idempotent order-preserving partial transformations (of an n-element chain) of waist k (waist(alpha) = max(Im(alpha)).
reference: Laradji, A. and Umar, A. Combinatorial results for semigroups of order-preserving partial transformations. Journal of Algebra 278, (2004), 342-359.
example: G(3,2) = 6 because there are exactly 6 idempotent order-preserving partial transformations (on a 3-element chain) of waist 2, namely: (2)->(2), (1,2)->(1,2), (1,2)->(2,2),(1,3)->(3,3), (2,3)->(2,2), (2,3)->(3,3) - the mappings are coordinate-wise
results.author: _Abdullahi Umar_, Aug 25 2008
